lines.text: [introducing David to her friend Blanche]
[spoken with Jamaican patois]
Ah... der be da tarment of me existence. Dey call him Devid.
Chow Bobo. Me not da tarment of HER existence. In dis house, de tarment is everywhere and de Ja-MEEEEEEEE-can woman tarment me fa certain as much as me tarment her.
Where him learn patois?
Only one place I can think of.
Dahn talk dat way. Anly looooow class people talk dat way.
Child, dan't encourage him.
Why do you touch me like that?
Like what?
Like that!
I'm sorry.
Don't you never touch me like that again. You understand me?
I'm sorry, I'm sorry. I didn't think it would upset you.
You didn't think it would upset me? You keep your hands off or I'm pressing charges! You understand what I'm telling you? You understand what I'm telling you? You get out now, you get out!
Um David, what do you think of your dad's apartment?
Well, it's pretty goddamn ostentatious if you ask me, but of course that's just a kid's opinion. I mean, I don't even speak Italian. Are you sexually involved with my father?

[in Jamaican patois]
Where you get dis here white child Miz Blanche?

[in Jamaican patois]
She get me at a church bazaar. I was lef' dere in da manger.

[in Jamaican patois]
I should be slappin' yer backside fer all da trouble ya givin' my Clara.

[also in Jamaican patois]
Oh no sweet dahlin'; dat's anudda moo-moo ya talkin' 'bout. See, dis child is meek and give da woman nuttin' but joy.
